intro: Seseli elatum, commonly known as the tall milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features tall, slender stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Seseli elatum is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas.
